channel.title: Making a custom item (weapon) attack with it, instead of punching
channel.description:
Hey,
I've set it up in the item4.java, and in the item.cfg files, it's looking nice and working perfectly.. apart from one thing.. when i attack things, it punches and the weapon disappears.
It has stats, a name, and wields properly (in wep slot)
[IMG]http://i39.tinypic.com/jf965t.jpg[/img] -> when i attack -> [IMG]http://i41.tinypic.com/xe3gqt.jpg[/img]
...
Any idea's how to make it slash with the wep?
Anyone had the same problem?
Thanks :)

item.title: Making a custom item (weapon) attack with it, instead of punching
item.dc:creator: @Setsuna Setsuna
item.description:
@Setsuna wrote:

[quote=“skinzoskinz, post:5, topic:286451”]oh soz

Can you help me with somthing else?..

When i use the special i just added:

if (playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 16550 && specialAmount >= 50) { animation(433, EnemyY, EnemyX); calculateSpecial(); hitDiff = specialDamage +60; usingSpecial = false; specialDamage = 0; specialDamage2 = 0; specialAmount -= 50; }

It works totally perfectly on NPC’s… but in the wilderness it wont let me special on players…

Is there somewhere saying like… no special on players?

I wana change it!!

Thanks alot :D[/quote]

No clue, sorry. Not good with pvp things.

Read full topic

It works totally perfectly on NPC’s… but in the wilderness it wont let me special on players…

I wana change it!!

item.title: Making a custom item (weapon) attack with it, instead of punching
item.dc:creator: @Setsuna Setsuna
item.description:
@Setsuna wrote:

Search for this in your client class:

public int GetWepAnim() {

Add this under it…

if (playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == WEAPONID) // weapon name...info...etc.... { return WEAPON ANIMATION; }

Replace WEAPONID with the ID of your new weapon and WEAPON ANIMATION with your desired attack animation.

Read full topic
